This is the ultimate total war experience! As the eastern empire I found myself scrambling to balance dealing with unrest and barbarian invasions. I adopted historical strats to manage it. In the eastern more volatile part of my territory I deployed a mobile legion of Calvary, because I could not afford to adequately fortify all the border cities, and repel the ever present rebels. In this way I could pin invading armies between the mobile legion and a city, or create a fort, and do it that way.

All my units keep disappearing after a battle and i take control of a town........please fix this
replyContent:
Some factions begin the campaign as a horde, meaning they have a special rule when attacking settlements.

If you occupy a settlement after capturing it, your armies will start to become part of the settlement's population. If you don't wish to settle your horde and carry on with it intact, choose "Sack Settlement" when capturing a settlement.

replyContent:
Please check our latest beta update that has a fix for the S20:

- Open the Google Play Store 
- Locate the game and enter its listing on the Google Play Store
- Scroll down the game's page until you see 'Join the Beta' and tap 'Join'
- Wait until the message shows 'You're a beta tester'

We'd love to hear if it has helped to solve any issues!

Good graphics

" I found something wrong with the campaign of the Hun, wherever i go conquered enemy cities and occupy that settlement, then all my troop suddenly disappear. Please fixed it ASAP. Thank you" Oh I got it now... when I sack the settlement and then i must occupy that bcoz no population left... So, that means it still need my troop to be a part of the population of that settlement? I already sack the settlement twice until no one left, and occupy it but other my troop surround me also gone.
replyContent:
The Huns and some other factions begin as a horde, meaning they have a special rule when attacking settlements.

If you occupy a settlement after capturing it, your armies will start to become part of the settlement's population. If you don't wish to settle your horde, choose "Sack Settlement" when capturing a settlement.

We hope this helps.

content: Best gaaame

What an excellent port of an amazing game! Great UI, totally smooth battles, and amazing grand strategy! replyContent:
Thanks for your purchase.

You will be able to build a mine in the game in some provinces, but this depends on location. Mines can only be used to harvest gold or silver; other resources such as copper are mined and traded automatically.

If there is anything else you wish to discuss, please contact us directly via support@feralinteractive.com

serious troubles finding things in Ui, setting governors, seeing public order change predictions, tax ect. bring back the easy access buttons from pc versions, you could have them in a pop out menu so as not to crowd the UI. otherwise campaign map done very well. Battle map. seems I cant draw boxes around units to select them.... this is a total killer in a tw game. bloody good attempt, I'm giving it 4 star generously though as i expect that updates will be forthcoming.
Fun as hell tho at first it confused me but I got the hang of it over time. The controls are interesting but not terrible.
This is agreat game and a taste of future phone gameing.

content: Good game. Very nicely adapted from pc too Android.

I can actually change the faction heir now. I was not able to do so on Rome Total War. My only negative thought is I cannot save right before a battle as I can on my PC. This means if I have multiple battles that are engaged by the AI while during the turn change I am f*****. If I lose the battle. That means I am forced to go back an entire turn and have to hope I can win every battle. Otherwise I will lose multiple battles and/or cities. This lack of the original feature can make your blood boil
replyContent:
If you wish to change a faction heir in ROME, you can do so via the Faction Summary screen, then view information on your faction's alliances, finances and family tree. View your family tree, then hold the family tree statue icon and you can change the heir. 

To save before a battle, swipe three fingers down to show the menu.

We hope this helps.

content: can anyone explain after capturing a settlemet why my army vanishes i was having 1100 troops while capturing a settlement after war ended it showed i got 900 troops left, but when i checked in the settlement there was no army except general. please help me out with this
replyContent:
The Huns and some other factions begin the campaign as a horde. If you choose to occupy a settlement after capturing it, your armies will start to become part of the settlement's population. 

If you don't wish to settle your horde and carry on with it intact, choose "Sack Settlement" when capturing a settlement.

We hope this helps.

Campaign portion is excellent and very faithful to the PC original. Fighting on the battlefield is a trickier experience, though. Also, unit sizes are v small, so battles are quick and not epic, but epic battles was the main draw of the desktop original. Modding currently not possible, nor editing game preferences. Options limited. 4 stars, still a great port.

content: Works perfectly on my Xiaomi Poco F1, running LineageOS 16

This is an update from my last review. It might be just me but downloading this involved several crashes. I'm not sure if this would be an android issue or this game but regardless the gameplay is great once it's downloaded. Lots of support including easy touch controls and battery life reports. The battles can be fiddly but with a bit of practice it works well (I find the pause button makes things move a bit smoother). Definitely up there as one of the best ports to mobile. Thanks for Feral Interactive for sending support on these reviews too.

Much like the original, Feral Interactive have completed an incredible port of the official expansion pack to Rome: Total War. This is the full game in all it's glory with nothing cut out or streamlined in a derogatory way, but with QoL improvements with usable touch controls and improved resolution art. Playing as Western Rome and maintaining the dying Empire wherever you may be is an incredible experience for me, just as I remember it on PC. True hardcore strategy for mobile. Recommended.
runs great on my galaxy S7, love the newer mechanics added since the base game. hopefully the Alexander version wont be far behind :D
I've been waiting for this since Rome Total War came out.  So far it's great!
Feral has done a great job with this game
I mean i get to play a total war game on your phone what more could you want???

its day one as I'm writing this, so the little bugs it has are fine. load and selection screen stuff mostly. I have both versions and barbarians add several big new gameplay elements that turned total war fans on their ears 20 years ago, so there are port issues. but these guys are like the anti-Bethesda or anti-ea, the game works day one for a one time price. dlc and porting done right, well done everyone at feral.
Fantastic game and great value! Well worth the asking price. Feral do us all a favour and add mod support! Fans of the game note unit size can be changed to enable hundreds of troops with xml editor.

hell yeah! long awaited release. only gripe is the manual battles are a little clunky and awkward due to screen size but that's not really the developers fault is it. Would of been nice to see more diplomatic options and sometimes the diplomatic responses can be a bit daft. (surround a factions last settlement and send a diplomat to demand they become a protecorate and get the reply "freedom is a precious thing to give up" BETTER THAN DEATH SURELY!. Anyway love it. please do medieval 2 next.

Purchased this today and already astonished yet again with the work Feral have put into this. A full port and beyond, with all factions playable, especially the Roman British faction which I genuinely cannot remember being able to play as on the PC original. Fantastic work getting this update on mobile along with Rome Total War and very much looking forward to Alexander and Medieval 2, hopefully also making an arrival to Android in future. Note: Unit size change in "more options", in game.
